Detailed Description

Generates colors that correspond with minecraft blocks.

Typedef Documentation

typedef png_byte*(* color_get_func)(void *, uint16_t)

The expected format for the get function of a color map.

Parameters:
void* A void pointer to a color_map.
uint16_t The block type whose color you are requesting
Returns:
A pointer to a position in the colors array of the color_map. Applications wishing to use this color must use the color_depth to determine how many bytes to copy out of this array.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum color_map_errors

Error codes that can be returned by color_map_get().

Enumerator:
COLOR_MAP_OK  Everything is OK.
COLOR_MAP_ERR_NOMAP  No color_map was passed.
COLOR_MAP_ERR_NODEST  No destination was passed.
COLOR_MAP_ERR_BLOCK  An invalid block type was passed.

Function Documentation

void color_map_free ( color_map *  doomed  ) 

Frees a color map.

Parameters:
doomed The color_map to destroy

png_byte* color_map_get ( color_map *  map,
uint16_t  block_type 
)

Retrieves a color from the color map.

Parameters:
map A color_map to get a color from
block_type The block_type whose color you want
Returns:
A pointer to the location of your color, or NULL on error.

color_map* color_map_new ( png_byte *  colors,
uint16_t  block_count,
uint8_t  color_depth,
color_get_func  get 
) [protected]

constructs a new color map.

Parameters:
colors A png_byte array of colors
block_count How many blocks are in this color map
color_depth How many bytes each color occupies
get A function to use to retrieve a color from the map
Returns:
A new color_map, or NULL on error.

int color_map_write ( color_map *  map,
png_byte *  destination,
uint16_t  block_type 
)

Finds the color of a requested block type and write it to a buffer.

Parameters:
map A color_map to get a color from
destination The destination buffer to receive the color.
block_type The block type whose color you want
Returns:
0 on success, a nonzero value in color_map_errors on error.
